blocks.content:
Transformations are a powerful way to manipulate data returned by a query before the system applies a visualization. Using transformations, you can:

- Rename fields
- Join time series/SQL-like data
- Perform mathematical operations across queries
- Use the output of one transformation as the input to another transformation

In this interactive guide, you'll set up a basic dashboard using the preinstalled Grafana data source and briefly explore the Transformations tab.
Click **New** in the top-right corner of the screen and select **New dashboard**.
Click **Add visualization** and select the Grafana data source.
Click **All visualizations** to display the full list of visualization types.

blocks.content: In the **Queries** tab below the panel, change the **Series count** to 2 to add another series to the visualization.
Great! You've set up a basic dashboard. Now let's check out transformations.
Below the panel, click the **Transformations** tab.
Awesome! You've arrived at the Transformations tab. Here, you can choose from several options to improve how your data displays insights for you.

To save space, not all of the available transformations are displayed initially. Scroll to the bottom of the tab and click **+ Show more** to open the **Add another transformation** drawer. 

Then scroll down and select **Add field by calculation**.

The transformation has been added to your panel configuration. It lets you add more fields to your visualization by running calculations on existing fields.

The default selection is **Total,** which  adds another series to the visualization by summing the existing series values.
Now, let's review what else you can do in the ****Transformations**** tab. You can:

Add another transformation. 

We'll add the **Filter fields by name**, which lets you quickly filter data out of the visualization.
Use this button located at the bottom of the tab to delete all transformations if you don't need them anymore.
Or use this icon to delete a single transformation.
Click **Filter** and choose which parts of the data the transformation applies to.
Click the information icon to view documentation on how to use this transformation in a drawer. Click the "x" in the top-right corner of the drawer to close it again when you're done.
Congratulations! Now you know where to find several different options for transforming your data.
